forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Isolated Rain Showers then Partly Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: Isolated rain showers before 11pm. Partly cloudy, with a low around 50. West wind around 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny, with a high near 62. West northwest wind 3 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

weather_report:
As night deepens over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle rhythm of isolated rain showers lingers before 11 PM, painting the evening air with a sprinkle of moisture. The chill sets in, cloaked in a subdued layer of clouds, offering a comfortable embrace at around 50 degrees. A westward breeze whispers through the streets, inviting you to wrap up snugly in a light jacket, perhaps with a cozy scarf to fend off the brisk draft. The chance of precipitation hangs in the air like unmade plans, just 20 percent, yet it stirs a sense of uncertain anticipation.

Tomorrow bids a warm welcome, revealing a sunlit canvas as the day unfolds. A high near 62 awaits, gently coaxing the city from its cool repose. With winds stirring from the west-northwest, it’ll be a delightful opportunity to breathe in the freshness of the early day. The horizon will clear, allowing sunbeams to dance across the familiar skyline, inviting quiet strolls along the Embarcadero or perhaps a visit to your favorite café for a steaming cup of coffee. There’s an exuberance woven into the fabric of tomorrow—a chance to embrace the outdoors, weather permitting, before the golden evening slips behind the hills.
